author: Rebecca Ballhaus
title: Senate Panel Releases Testimony on Trump Tower Meeting With Russians
text:
WASHINGTON—Documents released Wednesday shed new light on how a group of Russians promised associates of Donald Trump’s presidential campaign incriminating information on Hillary Clinton but instead presented their case for rolling back a U.S. sanctions law targeting Russian human-rights abusers.
Testimony by those who attended a June 9, 2016 meeting at Trump Tower suggests the Russians pressed the aides on the sanctions but offered little compromising material on Mrs. Clinton, instead urging the Trump aides to do their own... RELATED VIDEO What People Really Mean When They Say 'Collusion' When it comes to the Russia investigation, the word "Collusion" gets thrown around a lot. But there's not a lot of clarity on what it actually means. Is it illegal? Is it grounds for impeachment? We asked a law professor to explain. Photo Illustration: Drew Evans/The Wall Street Journal.
